Comment: Dear Reddit, this is your reminder that the boomers you blame everything on…This was them. Reddit loves to say they are living through the worst times in American history. Boomers lived through one president getting his head blown off, the next president escalating the Vietnam war and eventually deciding they didn’t want to run for president again, then the next president being Richard Nixon and Watergate and resigning. You had Kent State, the Cuban Missile Crisis, Watergate, Vietnam. But despite all of that going on, they still brought about the anti-war movement, the civil rights movement, and the free love movement. And yet Reddit bashes them for doing nothing and blames all their ills on the evil boomers.
Author: Saber-Rattler-3448

Comment: Before Kent State, there was the Orangeburg Massacare that happened on February 8, 1968 at the South Carolina State College in Orangeburg, SC. Black students were protesting when 28 were shot (mostly in the back) by state police. 3 were killed.  It was the first university killing of protestors by police officers in  American history.    https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orangeburg_Massacre
Author: Nah_nevamind

Comment: Kent State was horrific, but nowhere near comparable to Tiananmen Square. Kent State had 4 people gunned down by the national guard, we don't even know how many people were killed at Tiananmen Square, with the official report saying 300, but estimates being in the thousands. The American government also acknowledges Kent State much more than the Chinese government acknowledges Tiananmen Square. Finally they were caused by different factors. Kent State was the result of some trigger happy guardsmen, they weren't acting under orders from the higher ups. They weren't told to go in an open fire on protesters. Meanwhile that's exactly what happened during Tiananmen Square, Chinese soldiers killing civilians on the orders of the Chinese government.
Author: CombinationRough8699

Comment: You focused-in on the Nixon part of those lyrics, and you are correct, he didn't send the national guard. The governor of Ohio did.  Now that we have that out of the way, this song _focuses_ on dead students that were shot by that national guard. (Funny your first impulse was to defend Nixon?) Further, if you actually read the link, you would have known Nixon _did_ have an impact at Kent State by invading Cambodia while giving the US public the false impression that the Vietnam war was winding down. That was the _whole point_ of those Kent State protests, at the time.  and it was explained in that link above. Characterizations as though Nixon had nothing to do with what happened at Kent State are disengenous.
